properties.text: Louka, pronounced [looka] to a Polish person sounds like a gap - a lack of something, implying incompletness. Am I incomplete as a single person? Having grown up in the believe that a human is 'a half of an apple' and somewhere there is another human who is the other half, the better half, I do often wonder.

It's Saturday and these streets seem so empty. Passing an empty sports field. Don't people play sports on Saturday. Why is this field so alone? Why does 'empty' bring me to think 'lonely'? Again, the lack of something resurfaces.

To be an anarchist. Not being in a relationship feels like going against the grain. People assume that being single is a temporary state between being in a relationship and searching for a new one. Viv Albertine of the punk band The Slits said in a recent interview we have to stop telling girls that the only way a life can be fulfilling is when you are with someone.
Are we just scared monkeys holding on to each other for life out of fear? Fear is not a good driving force for progress.

Have you ever felt like this?, he said. Broken. Abandoned by someone, then, in the most vulnerable state taken advantage of and dismantled of parts rendering useless. He didn't say he's make me feel like that.
A quiet spot. Hundreds of eyes hiding around. Yet, no one in sight.

The sign reads: Drinks cold as your ex's heart. And finally there's the station. First date: he picked me up and I couldn't believe how nice he was. The day was sunny, early autumn. I had no expectations, yet I went back to the same station, the same evening feeling like the world had transformed. Now, back at the station, back to square zero.
